                                                                                                    What does this team do?Our IT audit team focuses on understanding the technology systems that businesses use to record transactions and report company results and key metrics. Once known, we identify and test the controls management put in place to mitigate these risks – across areas like access security, change management and system operations. We also acquire an expert knowledge of the company’s cyber security processes and use of emerging technologies, such as AI and robotic process automation.In this technology focused team, you’ll obtain valuable insight into how large, complex and high performing businesses are run, what technology and digital processes enable business success, how this connects to their broader business strategy and how they manage and control the risks. You’ll learn to speak ‘tech’ in a way that can be understood, explaining to others the impact of IT issues on the company and its financial results. A highly sought-after skill.You’ll get to work on a range of businesses from large international companies listed in the FTSE100, to smaller businesses. Each will give you invaluable knowledge and insight. You may even have the opportunity to travel overseas, as many of the organisations we work with have a global footprint.What skills and academic qualifications do I need?This programme is for university students who are doing well academically and want to test their skills in the real world.  You need to be on track to achieve a predicted degree classification of 2:1 or above in any discipline. You must also be in the penultimate year of your course. If you’re fascinated by business and can’t wait to get stuck into complex projects that make a difference, you’ll fit right in.  What kind of work will I do?Imagine trying out a career for a year before you commit.
